item.description:
KONSTANTIN VOLOSTNOV, ORGAN

7:30 p.m.
Admission: Free
Trinity Chapel

This young, international award-winning musician and Moscow native performs works by Bach, Dumage, Mozart, Ljapunov, Franck, and Vierne.

Born in Moscow in 1979, Volstnov studied at the prestigious Tchaikovsky Conservatory (diploma 2004, post-graduate 2007) and at Stuttgart's State University of Music and Performing Arts (diploma 2007). In 2009 he received first prize at the St. Albans International Organ Festival in the U.K. where he was also awarded with the Audience Prize and top honors for his interpretations of Bach and the world premiere of John Casken`s "Sacrificium."

Related web site: www.volostnov.ru
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the front lobby of the chapel, will wear bw scarf with piano keys
item.name: KONSTANTIN VOLOSTNOV, ORGAN
